problem: Define $g$ by $g(x)=5x-4$. If $g(x)=f^{-1}(x)-3$ and $f^{-1}(x)$ is the inverse of the function $f(x)=ax+b$, find $5a+5b$.
solution: Setting the expressions for $g(x)$ equal to each other, we get $5x-4=f^{-1}(x)-3$, so $f^{-1}(x)=5x-1$.  If we substitute $f(x)$ into this equation for $x$, we get  \[f^{-1}(f(x))=5f(x)-1.\]Since $f(f^{-1}(x))=x$ for all $x$ in the domain of $f^{-1}$, we have $x = 5f(x) - 1$.  Solving for $f(x)$, we find \[f(x) = \frac{x + 1}{5}.\]Thus, $a=\frac{1}{5}$ and $b=\frac{1}{5}$, so $5a+5b=\boxed{2}$.
model_solution:
Step 1: The given equation is $g(x)=f^{-1}(x)-3$, and we know that $g(x)=5x-4$. We can express $f^{-1}(x)$ in terms of $g(x)$ as follows: $f^{-1}(x)=g(x)+3$.

$g(x)+3=f^{-1}(x)$
Step 2:
\begin{align*}
f^{-1}(x)&=g(x)+3\\
&=(5x-4)+3\\
&=5x-1.
\end{align*}
Step 3:
\begin{align*}
f(x)&=y\\
x&=f^{-1}(y)\\
x&=5y-1\\
f(y)&=5y-1.
\end{align*}
Step 4:
\begin{align*}
f(y)&=5y-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad ax+b&=5y-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad ax+b-5y&=-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad a(x-5y)+b&=-1
\end{align*}
Step 5:
\begin{align*}
a(x-5y)+b&=-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad a(x-5y)&=-b-1
\end{align*}
Step 6:
\begin{align*}
a(x-5y)&=-b-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad a(x-5y)&=-b-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad a(x-5y)+5by&=-b-1+5by\\
\Rightarrow\qquad ax-5ay+5by&=-b+5by-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad ax+5by-5ay&=-b+5by-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad ax+5by-5ay&=-b(1-5y)+5by-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad (a-5a)y&=-b(1-5y)+5by-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad (a-5a)y&=-b+25by-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad (a-5a)y&=-b+25by-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad (a-5a)y&=-b+25by-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad (a-5a)y&=-b+25by-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad (a
\begin{align*}
(-4a)y&=-b+25by-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad -4ay&=-b+25by-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad (-4a)y&=b(25y-1)-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad (-4a)y&=b(25y-1)-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad (-4a)y&=b(25y-1)-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad (-4a)y&=-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad (-4a)&=1
\end{align*}
Step 7:
\begin{align*}
-4a&=1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad -4a\cdot\frac{1}{-4}&=1\cdot\frac{1}{-4}\\
\Rightarrow\qquad a&=-\frac{1}{4}
\end{align*}
\begin{align*}
-4a&=1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad -4a\cdot\frac{1}{-4}&=1\cdot\frac{1}{-4}\\
\Rightarrow\qquad a&=-\frac{1}{4}\\
\Rightarrow\qquad -4a+b&=-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad -4\left(-\frac{1}{4}\right)+b&=-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad 1+b&=-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad 1+b-1&=-1-1\\
\Rightarrow\qquad b&=-2
\end{align*}
\begin{align*}
5a+5b&=5\left(-\frac{1}{4}\right)+5(-2)\\
&=-\frac{5}{4}-10
\end{align*}
